comments:
I20070418

I am not sure if this is a valid use case.  But since I found so many exceptions in the log, I have decided to log this.

I had com.abc.sampleAdapter installed in an older driver.  As I updated to a new driver, I did not install the sample.  I had a few launch configurations that are related to the sample plugin.  

When I use the newer driver to open up an existing workspace, I found the error log being filled with these exceptions.  I got an exception on every tooltip update.  

This could be problematic if the user has a some plugins installed that contributed to a bunch of launch configurations and if the user uninstalls the plugin or upgrades without these plugins, we will get these exceptions.  The user will not be able to reuse an existing workspace.

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Launch configuration type id "com.abc.sampleadapter.samplelaunch.iextendedmemoryblock" does not exist.
Possible causes:
	Missing specification of a launch type (missing plug-in)
	Incorrect launch configuration XML
